result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

09:21 AM Defendant Laryan J Moore in court, in custody, with attorney Justin G Griffis.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense is waiting for some outstanding discovery.  Hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on July 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:28 AM Defendant Laryan J Moore in court, in custody, with attorney Justin G Griffis.   Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  City of Brookfield, police officer, Iverson sworn and testified on direct by Atty. Sitzberger.  Cross examination by Atty. Griffis.  State rests.  Testimony closed.  Atty. Sitzberger moves for bind over.  Atty. Griffis makes closing statements.    Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 3, 2022 at 10:15 am.

THE COURT CONVERTS THE SIGNATURE BOND TO A $50.00 CASH BOND.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Kohls listed in the Criminal Complaint.

09:24 AM Defendant Laryan J Moore in court, in custody, with attorney Justin G Griffis.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court notes that there was miscommunication and the State did not have their witness present. 
The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defendant as it related to prelim times as the Defendant requested a prelim within 20 days.
The Defendant is freely, knowingly, and voluntarily waiving the time limits just outside of 20 days.
The Court will adjourn to the soonest prelim hearing date.

Attorney Griffis presents arguments and requests to modify bail to a small cash bail.
The State takes no position.
The Court will grant the Defense's Oral Motion to Modify Bail and will set convert the signature bond to a $50.00 cash bail with the same conditions.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 10:15 am.

**The State pointed out that the case was set for hearing (HE) and not prelim hearing (PH) so they did not send out witness notfication.**
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

08:46 AM Defendant Laryan J Moore in court, in custody, with attorney Justin G Griffis.   Attorney appears as friend of the court.  Jack A. Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court notes the defendant is currently pending on 22CF372 where cash bail was imposed and defendant is currently on a probation and parole hold.  Attorney Griffis states they will re-evaluate the defendant to ensure he qualifies for representation on this case and then he will be appointed to this matter as well.  Court sets matter for a status of counsel date this Friday so the defendant may be evaluated.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
